title: Getting started with quallmer
text: quallmer package provides powerful flexible framework integrating large language models research workflows. leveraging LLMs, users can automate various text, image, video, etc., processing tasks, summarization, classification, scoring. package’s ability structure LLM responses customize output formats makes valuable tool researchers analysts looking harness capabilities LLMs work. detailed examples use cases, please refer vignettes documentation provided package.

title: Example: Sentiment analysis
code: library(quallmer) ## Loading required package: ellmer #Example texts texts <- c( "This is wonderful!", "I really dislike this approach.", "The results are somewhat disappointing.", "Absolutely fantastic work!" )

what: Using annotate() for sentiment analysis of texts
title: Example: Sentiment analysis
code: # Load predefined sentiment task sentiment_task <- sentiment()  #Annotate texts result <- annotate(texts, task = sentiment_task, chat_fn = ellmer::chat_openai, model = "gpt-4o") ## [working] (0 + 0) -> 3 -> 1 | ■■■■■■■■■                         25% ## [working] (0 + 0) -> 0 -> 4 | ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■  100% result

code: @Manual{,   title = {quallmer: What the Package Does (Title Case)},   author = {Seraphine F. Maerz and Kenneth Benoit},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://SeraphineM.github.io/quallmer}, }

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: quallmer accessible easy--use R package qualitative researchers quickly apply AI-assisted annotation texts, images, pdfs, structured data. Using annotate() predefined custom tasks via define_task(), users can generate structured, interpretable outputs powered large language models (LLMs). package includes library example tasks (come). also provides agreement(), launches interactive app manually code data, compare LLM outputs human annotations, assess inter-coder reliability. quallmer makes AI-assisted qualitative coding accessible without requiring deep expertise programming machine learning.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: package provides following core functions:

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: generic function works LLM supported ellmer. Generates structured responses based predefined user-defined tasks.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: Create custom annotation tasks structured outputs. Uses system_prompt type_object() define LLM interpret inputs format outputs. Tasks created define_task() can passed directly annotate(). allows users tailor annotation process specific data types makes package extensible future use cases.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: Launches interactive app manually code data review LLM-generated annotations. Compares AI annotations human-coded data evaluate agreement inter-coder reliability.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: package supports LLMs currently available ellmer package: authentication usage LLMs, please refer respective ellmer documentation . example, use chat_openai models, need sign API key OpenAI can save .Renviron file OPENAI_API_KEY. use chat_ollama models, first download install Ollama. install models either command line (e.g. ollama pull llama3.1) within R using rollama package. Ollama app must running models used.

title: Define an annotation task — define_task
